intro: Ctenium trinii, commonly known as the narrowleaf ctenium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ctenium trinii is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
